title: Calories in Spaghetti Noodles
meta_description: Discover calories in spaghetti noodles per 100g serving, including carbs, protein, fat, and full nutrition breakdown for plain cooked pasta.
assumptions: Cooked plain spaghetti noodles (al dente), unenriched, no sauce, oil, or salt added; drained.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, wheat type, cooking time, and portion size. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: 100g of cooked spaghetti noodles contains about 158 kcal, mostly from carbs.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Add 1 tsp olive oil per 100 g

faqs.q: How many calories in 100g of cooked spaghetti noodles?
faqs.a: Approximately 158 kcal for plain cooked spaghetti noodles.

faqs.q: What are the carbs in spaghetti noodles?
faqs.a: About 30.9 g carbs per 100g, with 1.8 g fiber and 0.6 g sugars.

faqs.q: Do spaghetti noodles have protein or fat?
faqs.a: Yes, 5.8 g protein and 0.9 g fat per 100g cooked.

faqs.q: Calories in dry vs cooked spaghetti noodles?
faqs.a: Dry is higher at ~371 kcal per 100g; cooking absorbs water, reducing density.

faqs.q: How does brand affect calories in spaghetti noodles?
faqs.a: Enriched or organic varieties may vary by 10-20 kcal per 100g due to processing.
